title: Understanding Relative Frequency
text: Relative frequency is the ratio of the number of times a particular event occurs to the total number of events. It is often expressed as a fraction or percentage.

title: Calculate Relative Frequency for Apples
text: To find the relative frequency of people who prefer apples, divide the number of people who prefer apples by the total number of people surveyed.

title: Calculate Relative Frequency for Bananas
text: Similarly, calculate the relative frequency for bananas by dividing the number of people who prefer bananas by the total number of people surveyed.

title: Compare the Relative Frequencies
text: Compare the relative frequency of people who prefer apples to those who prefer bananas. Which is greater?
